description: Students investigate a specific topic connected to Dance, Africa, and the African Diaspora through lecture, readings, class discussions, the viewing of live and recorded dance, and group projects. Potential topics could include understanding the historical and cultural contexts and functions of African and African Diasporic dance forms, dance and social justice, and politics and the performing arts. Topics vary from term to term. May be repeated if the topic is different. Offered periodically.
name: Top: Dance Forms of Africa
title: Topics in Dance, Africa, and the African Diaspora
